> Does HERITRIX handle cookies? - in the UI there are two text-fiels for 
> save and load cookie-file !

Yes it does. Handling of cookies is done by default.

The load cookies option allows an operator to pre-load existing cookies file (in the Netscape's 
format.) Specified load cookie-file is pre-loaded before the first document fetch.
FYI: If your are an IE user you can use File- Import Export wizard to export IE cookies to the 
Netscape format.

The save cookies option allows an operator to specify a file where the cookies will be saved to 
after the crawl is done. Only non-expired cookies stored during the crawl will be saved to this file.

> When the crawler runs - does it save cookies recieved and deliver them 
> again?

Yes, the crawler is keeping a state of all cookies.

> I crawled a specific site: http://www.hkhkronprinsen.dk - The crawl went 
> fine - but when I look at the material all HTML-files has PHP-errors in 
> the top (session-ID-error originating from either missing or alternated 
> cookie)

Could you please provide more info. Maybe an excerpt of one of these pages. HTTP headers would be great.


> Does cookies undergo some character-encoding?

No. Cookies handling is done via HTTP headers and to my knowledge http headers are not encoded.

i.
